Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the absence of guns on the other side in the mass shooting at the nightclub.
Understate: The claim understates the fact that at least one person at the club fired at the shooter.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support to prove that there were no guns on the other side.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that if there were guns on the other side, there would have been fewer deaths, without providing evidence for this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the fact that an armed security guard was present at the scene of the shooting, suggesting an alternative explanation to the claim.
